Authors: Li Jin, Hayato Masuya, Izumi Okane, Yuichi Yamaoka
Title:
Ophiostoma sugadairense, a new species of the Ophiostoma
piceae complex associated with bark beetles infesting Japanese larch in
Japan
Abstract:
A new species in the Ophiostoma piceae complex was
isolated from bark beetles and beetle galleries infesting Japanese larch
in Japan, and was described as Ophiostoma sugadairense. Phylogenetic
analyses of the internal transcribed spacer (ITS) of the nuclear
ribosomal RNA genes (rDNA) region, partial β-tubulin, and elongation
factor-1α genes revealed that O. sugadairense was clearly separated from
other species of the O. piceae complex. The sexual morph of O.
sugadairense morphologically resembled that of O. breviusculum, but the
aexual morph was clearly distinguishable based on morphological
characteristics of the synnemata, such as the color and shape of the
stipe. Mating compatibility tests indicated that there is some degree of
reproductive isolation between O. sugadairense and O. piceae, O.
breviusculum, and O. subalpinum.
